text: Making the burgo pieces Mix the rice flour and salt.  Pour the water and the boiling water into the rice flour and salt mix. Stir well. Heat the omelette pan. Rub with a little cooking oil. Make the thin omelette by pouring two tablespoons of the batter into the pan. Heat until cooked. Lift and roll it.  Cut into pieces.  Making the sauce and grinding the spices Steam the tilapia fish. Separate the flesh from the skin of the fish, then mash the fish until crushed finely. Grind all of the spices.  Heat the cooking oil. Sauté all of the spices until fragrant. Add salt, coconut milk, the fish flesh, and water, then stir well until boiling. Remove from the heat.  Serving the burgo Serve burgo on a serving plate. Pour the sauce over the burgo pieces. Sprinkle with the fried onion. It is now ready to be served immediately.
